item.title: Three parties stage protests in front of EC demanding registration
item.description: Three political parties, which were denied registration by the Election Commission, staged demonstrations in front of Nirbachan Bhaban on Wednesday, demanding official recognition. The three parties—Aam Janatar Dal, Bangladesh Justice and Development Party, and Moulik Bangla—staged sep

item.title: Ambassador Mushfiqul promotes Bangladesh-Mexico trade ties at Querétaro
item.description: Bangladesh and Mexico have explored the new avenues of cooperation in trade, investment, pharmaceuticals and manufacturing, with emphasis on strengthening institutional partnerships between the business chambers of both the countries. Bangladesh Ambassador to Mexico Mushfiqul Fazal Ansarey underto

item.title: DU tops Bangladeshi universities in QS Asia Rankings again
item.description: University of Dhaka (DU) has once again been ranked as the top university in Bangladesh in the QS Asia University Rankings, published by the UK-based education and research organization Quacquarelli Symonds (QS). According to the rankings released on Tuesday, Dhaka University secured the 132nd pos

item.title: Fakhrul condemns gun attack on BNP’s candidate in Chattogram
item.description: BNP Secretary General Mirza Fakhrul Islam Alamgir on Wednesday strongly condemned the gun attack on the party’s candidate for Chattogram-8 Ershad Ullah, describing it as a clear attempt to create chaos and disrupt the upcoming 13th national election. In a statement, he also demanded the imme

item.title: BSF fires sound grenades at Lalmonirhat-Patgram border
item.description: Tensions flared at the Lalmonirhat-Patgram border as the Indian Border Security Force (BSF) fired three rounds of sound grenades early Wednesday morning, triggering panic among locals. The incident occurred near the Serampur Union in Patgram Upazila, in proximity to the Bangladesh-India border at

item.title: Reza Kibria joins BNP; likely to contest polls from Habiganj-1
item.description: Reza Kibria, son of late former finance minister Shah AMS Kibria, has joined BNP and is likely to contest the upcoming national election from the Habiganj-1 constituency. “I have already joined BNP and filled up its primary membership form some days ago,” Reza told UNB on Wednesday. item.title: Muntasir Mahmud permanently expelled from NCP
item.description: The National Citizen Party (NCP) has permanently expelled its southern region organiser Muntasir Mahmud on charges of breaching party discipline. According to a party statement issued on Wednesday, the decision was made by the NCP’s disciplinary committee. Muntasir, who had been working at

item.title: Envoy stresses stronger trade, energy and tourism ties with Nepal
item.description: Bangladesh Ambassador to Nepal Md Shafiqur Rahman has called for deepening economic cooperation between Bangladesh and Nepal through enhanced trade, connectivity, and investment in joint ventures, particularly in the sectors of energy and tourism. The envoy made the remarks this afternoon during a

item.title: BGMEA briefs IMF on RMG risks, urges govt to prioritize FTAs to counter LDC graduation challenge
item.description: A delegation from the International Monetary Fund (IMF) met with the Bangladesh Garment Manufacturers and Exporters Association (BGMEA) on Wednesday to discuss the current state and future risks of the country's ready-made garment (RMG) sector, aiming to ensure macroeconomic stability.
